kimononet.geo

Class GeoVelocity

  • java.lang.Object
    • kimononet.geo.GeoVelocity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parcelable

    public class GeoVelocity
extends java.lang.Object
implements Parcelable
    The class represents a GPS velocity vector. 
     
 GeoLocation initialLocation = new GeoLocation(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
 GeoVector v = new GeoVector(initialLocation);
 
 GeoLocation finalLocation = new GeoLocation(1.0, 1.0, 0.0);
 
 v.update(finalLocation);
 
 System.out.println(v);
    Author:
    Zorayr Khalapyan

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeoVelocity

        public GeoVelocity()
        Creates a new velocity vector that is not initialized at a certain point. At least two invocations of update(GeoLocation) will need to be made before producing valid @#getLongitudeComponent() or #getLatitudeComponent() results.

      • GeoVelocity

        public GeoVelocity(GeoLocation currentLocation)
        Creates a new vector initialized at the provided location. Initially, both change in longitude and change in latitude will be initialized to zero and will be modified once current location is updated using #updateLocation(GeoLocation).
        Parameters:
        currentLocation - The current location of the vector.

      • GeoVelocity

        public GeoVelocity(Parcel parcel)
